Module execute
Package org.zuky.dialogs

Class FolderBrowserDialog

java.lang.Object
org.zuky.dialogs.FolderBrowserDialog
public class FolderBrowserDialog extends Object
Allow you to navigate between system directories. By invoking the constructor FolderBrowserDialog(String) "" or the method setRoot(String) you can tell the dialog box in which directory to start browsing.

If you notice that it performs a function similar to FileDialog although note that in the dialog box it allows you to view files if required but it is more advisable to use FileDialog.

See Also:
  • Browse Dialog - Win32

  • Method Details

    • show

      public boolean show(Window parent)
      Displays the dialog box specifying the parent window for the modal state
      Parameters:
      parent - - the parent window
      Returns:
      is success

    • getDisplayName

      public String getDisplayName()
      Returns the name of the selected directory displayed in the text box.
      Returns:
      directory name

    • getAbsolutePath

      public String getAbsolutePath()
      Returns the absolute path of the selected element. If the dialog box was canceled the method returns null.
      Returns:
      absolute path

    • getRoot

      public String getRoot()
      Returns the path from where you started the search in the dialog box.

      note that if I select a directory, this method does not return the parent directory of the selected directory.

      Returns:
      root directory

    • setRoot

      public void setRoot(String root)
      Specifies in which directory the navigation should start. If the path entered is invalid or does not exist, in that case the dialog box will make the decision where to start.
      Parameters:
      root - directory path

    • getDescription

      public String getDescription()
      Returns the description of the dialog box. If no description has been set then it returns null.
      Returns:
      description

    • setDescription

      public void setDescription(String description)
      The dialog box allows you to display a description at the top of the tree folders.

      If no description is specified, no message will be displayed.

      Parameters:
      description - description of the dialog box
      See Also:
      • getDescription()

    • setButtonNewFolder

      public void setButtonNewFolder(boolean newFolder)
      If you need to have the option to create a directory by pressing a button you can enable this option.
      Parameters:
      newFolder - create folder

    • isButtonNewFolder

      public boolean isButtonNewFolder()
      Returns true if the dialog box displays the button to create a new directory.
      Returns:
      button new folder
      See Also:
      • setButtonNewFolder(boolean)

    • setIncludeFiles

      public void setIncludeFiles(boolean includeFiles)
      When the dialog box is displayed it will include in its search the files found in the directory.
      Parameters:
      includeFiles - include files
      See Also:
      • isIncludeFiles()

    • isIncludeFiles

      public boolean isIncludeFiles()
      Returns true if the dialog box includes files in navigation.
      Returns:
      include files
      See Also:
      • setIncludeFiles(boolean)

    • show

      public boolean show()
      Display the dialog box without defining a parent window
      Returns:
      true if the dialog box was closed correctly or false if it was canceled or an error occurred.
      See Also:
